text:
League 1
Bordeaux - Nantes streaming: where to see the match?
Bordeaux will host Nantes this Sunday, November 3 at 3 pm on behalf of the 12th day of Ligue 1. A match to follow in streaming.
03 Nov 2019, 04:45 by Coralie Room



Predrag RajkoviÄ‡ - ReimsAs every day of the championship, several individualities have distinguished themselves in Ligue 1. Discover the team-type of the weekend of the redaction.Icon Sport



Mohamed Simakan - StrasbourgIcon Sport



Thiago Silva - Paris Saint-GermainIcon Sport



Pablo Martinez - NÃ®mesIcon Sport



Ludovic Baal - BrestIcon Sport



Marco Verratti - Paris Saint-GermainIcon Sport



Paul Lasne - BrestIcon Sport



Angel Di Maria - Paris Saint-GermainIcon Sport



Yusuf YazÄ±cÄ± - LilleIcon Sport



Mauro Icardi - Paris Saint-GermainIcon Sport



Wissam Ben Yedder - MonacoIcon Sport

Simakan, Di Maria, Yazici, ... The typical team of the weekend in Ligue 1!




Nantes moves to the Matmut Atlantique to face Bordeaux this Sunday, November 3 at 15 hours, for the 12th day of Ligue 1. Paulo Sousa's men must maintain their high level of play. In the last 3 games, they have lost twice against Lille (3-0) and Saint-Etienne, but they relaunched against Dijon (2-0) in the Coupe de la Ligue. They are 10th in Ligue 1 currently.
For their part, the Canaries remain on a card in the Coupe de la Ligue. They won 8-0 against Paris FC. Christian Gourcuff was proud of his players after the match. In Ligue 1, Nantes has not won since October 5th.








Bordeaux - Nantes streaming




Paulo Sousa, Bordeaux coach + 11 ðŸ“·Credit Photo - Icon Sport

This meeting between Bordeaux and Nantes, which counts for the 12th day of Ligue 1 is broadcast on French television on beIN Sports 1 this Sunday, November 3 from 15h French time. A match that you will also watch live streaming video.

Either via the subscription service (so paying) beIN Sports Connect available on PC & Mac via an Internet browser (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, etc.) but also on iPhone, iPad, Android, Xbox One, PS4, Chromecast or Apple TV.
Either from iOS and Android applications and from your TV provider (ISP or pay per view like Canal +): Orange TV, SFR TV, MyCanal ...
